comments.author: dreapadoir@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: TBird 3.0.11; Mozilla 5.0

>>I have made screen snaps of the window. Where do I send them?<<
Window content: "You are about to override how Thunderbird identifies this site.
[bold text follows]Legitimate banks, stores, and other public sites will not ask you to do this.
Server
Location:pop3.live.com:995
Certificate Status
This site attempts to identify itself with invalid information.

[bold text follows] Wrong Site

Certificate belongs to a different site, which could indicate identity theft.

In the General Tab, SSL Server Certificate issued to pophm.sympatico.ca, Bell Canada

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
Unknown; may be triggered by periodic checking for new mail.




Where can I send screen snaps of this?
comments.creator: dreapadoir@yahoo.com

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #0)
> Build Identifier: TBird 3.0.11; Mozilla 5.0

Thunderbird 3.0.11 is no-longer supported.

Please update to the latest 3.1.x version (currently 3.1.9) and see if you can reproduce the issue there.

> Where can I send screen snaps of this?

They can be attached to this bug, but please try updating first.

comments.author: standard8@mozilla.com

comments.text: Upon selecting Update, 3.1.8 is offered with a warning that ESET Smart Security extension will not work. When will the ESET extension be supported?
comments.creator: dreapadoir@yahoo.com
comments.author: dreapadoir@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text: Upon selecting Update, 3.1.8 is offered with a warning that ESET Smart Security extension will not work. When will the ESET extension be supported?

comments.author: standard8@mozilla.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Upon selecting Update, 3.1.8 is offered with a warning that ESET Smart Security
> extension will not work. When will the ESET extension be supported?

The ESET extension is a third-party extension, so you will need to check with ESET to see if there is an update to their software - from a quick search on the internet, it appears that there is an ESET update that will support Thunderbird 3.1, so you may want to try getting that first.
comments.creator: standard8@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Upon selecting Update, 3.1.8 is offered with a warning that ESET Smart Security
> extension will not work. When will the ESET extension be supported?

The ESET extension is a third-party extension, so you will need to check with ESET to see if there is an update to their software - from a quick search on the internet, it appears that there is an ESET update that will support Thunderbird 3.1, so you may want to try getting that first.
